name: DDoS
description: Distributed Denial of Service. Overloads a server with traffic to make it unavailable. Often uses UDP.

name: ARP Spoof
description: Address Resolution Protocol Spoofing. Attacker links their MAC address with the IP address of a legitimate computer or server.

name: SQL Injection
description: Malicious SQL code injected into web forms to manipulate a database. Often seen in HTTP traffic.

name: Port Scan
description: Attempt to identify open ports on a host, often a precursor to an attack. Can involve many TCP SYNs.

name: Malware Download
description: Malicious software being downloaded onto a system, often disguised as legitimate files. Carried over HTTP.
